intro: Oxydectes bifurcata, commonly known as the bifurcate oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, two-lobed fruit capsules that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Oxydectes bifurcata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
